Container.Name: owncloud-infinite-scale
Container.Overview:
ownCloud Infinite Scale (oCIS) is the new file sync & share platform that will be the foundation of your data management platform.
https://github.com/owncloud/ocis

Config.Name: Self-Signed cert
Config.Description: Determines whether owncloud should use an auto-generated self-signed certificate. Setting to false requires a user provided signed certificate (or using a reverse proxy)

Config.Name: HTTP Service Bind Address
Config.Description: The bind address of the HTTP service (within the container). This should match the WEBUI port.

Config.Name: URL
Config.Description: Set to the FQDN you'll be using for owncloud. Can be an IP or a domain etc. Otherwise owncloud will use localhost (container address).

Config.Name: OIDC Issuer
Config.Description: URL of your OIDC Issuer. (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: OIDC Client ID
Config.Description: OIDC Client ID (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: OIDC Config URL
Config.Description: OIDC Config Endpoint (/.well-known/openid-configuration) (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: Rewrite OIDC config endpoint
Config.Description: Enables rewriting the /.well-known/openid-configuration to the configured OIDC issuer. Needed by the Desktop Client, Android Client and iOS Client to discover the OIDC provider. (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: Token Verification Method
Config.Description: Sets how OIDC access tokens should be verified. Possible values are 'none' and 'jwt'. When using 'none', no special validation apart from using it for accessing the IPD’s userinfo endpoint will be done. When using 'jwt', it tries to parse the access token as a jwt token and verifies the signature using the keys published on the IDP’s 'jwks_uri'. (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)
